text: Your Friday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to ‘Rabbit Hole’Interviewing the world’s biggest YouTube influencer.
‘On Tech With Shira Ovide’Why all the shouting about Google?

Trump Urges Reopening of Houses of Worship as C.D.C. Suggests LimitsWading into the culture wars, President Trump declared houses of worship “essential” and ordered them reopened, without any clear authority to do so.The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended that religious communities limit the size of gatherings and take other precautions.The White House’s virus response coordinator expressed concern about cases in Los Angeles, Chicago and Washington, D.C. Here’s the latest.
After 3 Children Die, a Race to Investigate a Baffling Virus SyndromeAt least 161 children in New York have gotten sick, making the state’s caseload one of the largest publicly reported anywhere.

Economy
Hertz could file for bankruptcy if it can’t reach a deal with creditors.
China abandons growth target and lays plans to ramp up spending.
Summer internships are vanishing, closing off a route to full-time employment.
New York
N.J. allows outdoor gatherings of 25 people and lets campgrounds open.
A man drowns at Rockaway Beach as N.Y.C. considers when to open its beaches.
Prayers resume at a Brooklyn synagogue.
Global
U.K. announces a quarantine of all international air travelers.
A vaccine developed in China shows promise.
Listen to how the pandemic has hushed great cities.

Trump Suggests Inflated Death Count. Experts Believe It’s Even Higher.Senior White House and health officials have questioned the official counts. Many public health experts say the toll is in fact higher.

C.D.C. Test Counting Error Leaves Epidemiologists ‘Really Baffled’The Centers for Disease Control has been grouping results for active cases and recovered patients, boosting testing totals but muddying the pandemic’s course.

Xi’s Move to Rein In Hong Kong Is One of His Boldest YetAn emboldened China and its leader, Xi Jinping, have asserted themselves on national security, in line with Mr. Xi’s vision for a “great rejuvenation.”

Top U.S. Officials Threaten Action on China Over Hong Kong Security LawSecretary of State Mike Pompeo and the White House economic adviser, Kevin Hassett, signaled the Trump administration would punish China.
Hong Kong’s stock market plunged after China said it would impose national security laws on the territory.
Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. is continuing his transition from the Democratic primary to the general election. Saul Loeb/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

Why Biden and Warren Would Make the Oddest Ticket in DecadesIf Joe Biden selects Elizabeth Warren as his running mate, the ticket would be a marriage of contrasting policy ideas and governing philosophies.

Tara Reade’s Credentials Are Questioned; Lawyer Drops Her as ClientThe departure of a prominent #MeToo lawyer came after concerns over the expert witness credentials of Ms. Reade, who has accused Joe Biden of sexual assault.
Nicole Bass at Shapiro’s Delicatessen in Indianapolis on Thursday. About 25 of the employees there were tested in the parking lot this month. Luke Sharrett for The New York Times

Another Casualty of the Coronavirus: Summer InternshipsLike so much else, summer internships have been upended by the pandemic, with hundreds of companies canceling their programs and rescinding offers.
What Happened to the Great American Logistics Machine?Nobody could make supply chains sing like the United States. And now maybe nobody can, period.

Celebratory Flight Ends in Tragedy as Plane Crashes in PakistanAn Airbus A320 filled with military officers, executives and bankers crashed in a residential area near the Karachi airport, killing at least 80 people.
Coast & Geodetic Survey/NOAA Photo Library

Richard Malley and Marc LipsitchTreating Mild Coronavirus Cases Could Help Save EveryoneActing before or very soon after an infection is the best way to handle most acute viral diseases. Why aren’t we focusing on that with Covid-19?
Toby CecchiniCan Anyone Save New York’s Bars and Restaurants?Even when businesses like mine can open up for real, it will be very hard to keep them going in a socially distanced world.

Economy
Devastated by the pandemic, Hertz files for bankruptcy protection.
Airlines are given tentative approval to halt service at dozens of U.S. cities.
China abandons growth target and lays plans to ramp up spending.
New York
Groups of 10 people can now gather anywhere in New York for any reason.
N.J. allows outdoor gatherings of 25 people and lets campgrounds open.
A man drowns at Rockaway Beach as N.Y.C. considers when to open its beaches.
Global
U.K. announces a quarantine of all international air travelers.
A vaccine developed in China shows promise.
Listen to how the pandemic has hushed great cities.

In Pushing to Open Churches, Trump Steps Into Culture WarsPresident Trump declared places of worship “essential” operations and ordered them opened, though legal experts said he did not have authority to do so.

Trump Suggests Inflated Death Count. Experts Believe It’s Even Higher.The numbers, some officials say, include too many “presumed” cases. But even Dr. Anthony Fauci said that the overall toll was likely an undercount.

C.D.C. Test Counting Error Stuns EpidemiologistsThe Centers for Disease Control has been grouping results for active cases and recovered patients, boosting testing totals but muddying the pandemic’s course.

Xi’s Move to Rein In Hong Kong Is One of His Boldest YetAn emboldened China and its leader, Xi Jinping, have asserted themselves on national security, in line with Mr. Xi’s vision for a “great rejuvenation.”

Top U.S. Officials Threaten Action on China Over Hong Kong Security LawSecretary of State Mike Pompeo and the White House economic adviser, Kevin Hassett, signaled the Trump administration would punish China.
Hong Kong’s stock market plunged after China said it would impose national security laws on the territory.
Hertz, Car Rental Pioneer, Files for Bankruptcy ProtectionThe company, which had amassed a large debt, has been devastated by the sharp drop in travel during the pandemic.

Employers Grapple With Question as They Reopen: To Test or Not to Test?Amazon and other companies are planning to test workers. But there is little federal guidance, and some fear it could lead to a false sense of security.

Another Casualty of the Coronavirus: Summer InternshipsLike so much else, summer internships have been upended by the pandemic, with hundreds of companies canceling their programs and rescinding offers.
Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. is continuing his transition from the Democratic primary to the general election. Saul Loeb/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
The White House is increasingly worried about Senator Kelly Loeffler’s prospects in Georgia.

Celebratory Flight Ends in Tragedy as Plane Crashes in PakistanAn Airbus A320 filled with military officers, executives and bankers crashed in a residential area near the Karachi airport, killing at least 80 people.
